page.title: 10TOURISM IN KETTLEWELL
page.content: Tourism is a growth industry and very important to the economy of the area as agriculture has become less labour intensive. Many cottages are now used as second homes for town dwellers or as holiday lets. The hotels and guest houses depend on tourists as do the local shops. As the demand for holiday cottages grows the price of houses remains inflated. Sadly this sometimes means that local youngsters have to move away to afford their first homes. However, tourism does provide work for a large number of people and in a village whose main industry was once lead mining the village is fortunate in that its location is attractive to visitors. The area provides scenic interest for many activities, such as walking, climbing, fishing and potholing, canoeing and painting.
